unnormalised: ## So, You're Renting in Mumbai, Eh? Let's Talk Rental Agreements, Yaar!
normalised: ## So, You're Renting in Mumbai, Eh? Let's Talk Rental Agreements, Yaar!

unnormalised: Alright guys, finding that perfect flat in Mumbai (or Delhi, or Bangalore, anywhere, really!) is just half the battle. The *real* grown-up stuff? The rental agreement. No stress, though! Think of it as your personal rulebook for your awesome new pad.
normalised: Alright guys, finding that perfect flat in Mumbai (or Delhi, or Bangalore, anywhere, really!) is just half the battle. The real grown-up stuff? The rental agreement. No stress, though! Think of it as your personal rulebook for your awesome new pad.

unnormalised: First things first: Get it in writing! Don't rely on just a handshake with Sharmaji. A written agreement protects both you and your landlord from misunderstandings down the line. Imagine, you thought your deposit was Rs. 20,000, and he remembers Rs. 15,000? Awkward, no?
normalised: First things first: Get it in writing! Don't rely on just a handshake with Sharmaji. A written agreement protects both you and your landlord from misunderstandings down the line. Imagine, you thought your deposit was rupee twenty thousand, and he remembers rupee fifteen thousand? Awkward, no?

unnormalised: What should be in it? EVERYTHING! Rent amount, maintenance charges (super important!), due date (mark it on your calendar!), and the duration of the lease. Typically, it's 11 months, to avoid some registration hassles, but double-check everything. My friend, Priya, learned that the hard way when her landlord tried to increase the rent after only 6 months! Nightmare fuel!
normalised: What should be in it? Everything! Rent amount, maintenance charges (super important!), due date (mark it on your calendar!), and the duration of the lease. Typically, it's eleven months, to avoid some registration hassles, but double-check everything. My friend, Priya, learned that the hard way when her landlord tried to increase the rent after only six months! Nightmare fuel!

unnormalised: Also, clearly mention the security deposit amount and the conditions for getting it back. Nobody wants to chase after Sharmaji for months to get their money back. Plus, clearly define who’s responsible for repairs. Leaky tap? Broken geyser? Get it in writing!
normalised: Also, clearly mention the security deposit amount and the conditions for getting it back. Nobody wants to chase after Sharmaji for months to get their money back. Plus, clearly define who's responsible for repairs. Leaky tap? Broken geyser? Get it in writing!

unnormalised: Speaking of timeframes, the agreement should clearly state the lock-in period. Many agreements have clauses stating that you can't vacate before, say, 6 months, or you lose your deposit. And ALWAYS note the date the agreement comes into effect! Let's say you sign it on 01/01/2024, but the actual rental starts on 15/01/2024, make sure it’s clear.
normalised: Speaking of timeframes, the agreement should clearly state the lock-in period. Many agreements have clauses stating that you can't vacate before, say, six months, or you lose your deposit. And always note the date the agreement comes into effect! Let's say you sign it on first january two thousand and twenty four, but the actual rental starts on fifteenth january two thousand and twenty four, make sure it’s clear.

unnormalised: Remember to include details about notice period. Usually it's 1 month but some landlords ask for 2 months, make sure it’s written!
normalised: Remember to include details about notice period. Usually it's one month but some landlords ask for two months, make sure it’s written!

unnormalised: Another crucial point: Include a clause about any rent increase! For instance, an annual increase of 5%. Transparency is key, people!
normalised: Another crucial point: Include a clause about any rent increase! For instance, an annual increase of five percent. Transparency is key, people!

unnormalised: Finally, read the entire document carefully. Twice! Don't be shy about asking questions. This is your home, after all! Once you're both happy, sign it, get it notarized if needed, and keep a copy safe. And for all those signing agreements after 09:00 hrs on 15/08/2024 , good luck! Renting in India can be tricky, but with a solid agreement, you’re halfway there. Happy renting, and may your landlord be as chill as Rahul Dravid!
